alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Johnston; Nash; Orange; Person; Vance; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 23 at 11:20PM EDT until May 24 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Durham County in central North Carolina... Franklin County in central North Carolina... Southern Granville County in central North Carolina... West Central Halifax County in central North Carolina... Northwestern Johnston County in central North Carolina... Nash County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Orange County in central North Carolina... Southern Person County in central North Carolina... Southern Vance County in central North Carolina... Wake County in central North Carolina... * Until 230 AM EDT. * At 1120 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 2 hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Rocky Mount, Hillsborough, Nashville, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Garner, Clayton, Butner, Zebulon, Franklinton, Dortches, Bailey, Kittrell, Bunn, RDU International and Rougemont. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Durham; Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Johnston; Nash; Orange; Person; Vance; Wake
